SEARCH
Package executor.service.facade.parallel

Class ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
executor.service.facade.parallel.ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ParallelFlowExecutorService
@Service public class ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl extends Object implements ParallelFlowExecutorService
Implementation of ParallelFlowExecutorService utilizing a configurable thread pool and an execution service for managing parallel flows of tasks.

The ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl class serves as a concrete implementation of the ParallelFlowExecutorService interface. It leverages a ThreadPoolExecutor for managing parallel execution of tasks and an ExecutionService for handling the actual execution logic of individual tasks.

Instances of this class are typically managed by a Spring container due to the @Service annotation. The configurable thread pool and execution service are injected via constructor injection, allowing for flexibility and testability.

Implementations of the ParallelFlowExecutorService interface should provide meaningful implementations for the execute() method, specifying the parallel flow management logic according to the specific use case.

Ensure proper configuration of the thread pool and execution service to align with the concurrency requirements and task execution characteristics of the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl

      @Autowired public ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl(ExecutionService executionService, ThreadPoolExecutor configurableThreadPool)
      Constructs a ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl with the provided execution service and a configurable thread pool for managing parallel flows of tasks.

      The constructor is annotated with Autowired and is responsible for initializing a new instance of the ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl class. It requires an ExecutionService and a ThreadPoolExecutor to be provided as dependencies.

      The provided execution service represents the logic for individual task execution within the parallel flow, while the configurable thread pool determines the concurrency and management of tasks in parallel.

      Instances of this class are typically managed by a Spring container, and the required dependencies are injected automatically due to the @Autowired annotation. Ensure proper configuration and initialization of the provided dependencies to align with the parallel execution requirements of the application.

      Parameters:
      executionService - The ExecutionService responsible for defining the logic of individual task execution within the parallel flow.
      configurableThreadPool - The configurable ThreadPoolExecutor for managing the parallel execution of tasks with specified concurrency limits.
      See Also:
      • Autowired
      • ParallelFlowExecutorService
      • ExecutionService
      • ThreadPoolExecutor

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the parallel flow of tasks using the configured thread pool and execution service. Tasks are submitted to the executor only if the thread pool is not terminated.

      The execute method is part of the ParallelFlowExecutorService interface implementation in the ParallelFlowExecutorServiceImpl class. It checks whether the configured thread pool is terminated before submitting tasks for execution. This ensures that tasks are only submitted when the thread pool is still active and capable of processing tasks concurrently.

      The specific logic for managing parallel flows, including task submission and execution, is determined by the implementation of the execution service. This method serves as a high-level entry point for initiating the parallel flow.

      It is crucial to consider the termination state of the thread pool to avoid submitting tasks after it has been shut down. Proper configuration and lifecycle management of the thread pool contribute to the overall reliability and performance of the parallel flow execution process.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface ParallelFlowExecutorService
      See Also:
      • ParallelFlowExecutorService.execute()
      • submitTasksToExecutor()
